availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Innes Brent Hopkins (Oldham County, Kentucky, clerk)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, clerk. Henderson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Virginia Caroline Taliaferro Hopkins in Oldham County, Kentucky, on April 23, 1845. Father of Mattie Belle Hopkins, Robert Hopkins, Innes Hopkins, Brent Hopkins, and Samuel Hopkins. Master in Chancery of Oldham County Court, in Oldham County, Kentucky, from 1853 to 1856. Elected Clerk of the Oldham County Court in 1854. Appointed as aide to Governor Beriah Magoffin in January 1860. Clerk in Oldham County in 1860. Unsuccessful candidate for Clerk of the Court of Appeals in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

"Oldham County," _Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), August 9, 1854, p. 3.
"Governor's Aids," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), January 6, 1860, p. 2.
"Full Official Vote of the State," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), September 5, 1860, p. 3.
“Death of Col. Brent Hopkins,” The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Kentucky), March 9, 1884, pg. 8.
